content.description:
Start as for "

Cross Walk

."  Once the mid point is gained climb more exit right following the swallowing crack/seam to yet another spooky exit!!

Tall and still crusty!!  Take care on the upper face!!  A fall from there would be serious!!
content.protection: Pads and spoters!!  Potential for a really bad fall!!
content.location: Located on the "Cross Block" about 20 feet east of the "Black Pearl" Boulder.

content.description:
Climb up the north east face and arete.  The problem is left of "

Cross Country

."  This line is also still dirty but worth a run.
content.location: Located on the "Cross Block" about 20 feet east of the "Black Pearl" Boulder.

content.description:
Climb up the crack on the west face.  Once you reach the lines mid point begin to climb on the leftward side of where the horizontal crack comes to a swallowing point.

Take care of mounting the somewhat lose block in the lower section of the problem.  If this block came off while you where on it....

This line is also a bit crusty, but with traffic this will be an area classic.
content.protection: Many pads and a spot.  A fall from the top-out moves could be really bad!!!
content.location: Located on the West facing side of "The Cross" block just 20 or so feet east of the "Black Pearl" boulder.

content.description:
Climb the north-west prow/arete via crimps and side pull pinches to a small shelf.  From here, continue climbing straight up.  Don't deviate too far left or the top-out officially ends on another line.

So, continue up onto easier, but spookier climbing above.

This climb is still very dirty but will clean up nice.  I would have given it 3 stars otherwise.
content.location: Located on the "Cross Block."  About 20 feet EAST of the "Black Pearl" Boulder.  The boulder features a cross like crack formation on its WEST face.
